title: Time to divest FAANG stocks?
text: CNBC's Josh Brown takes a question from John in Massachusetts about whether he should buy or sell some of his FAANG tech stocks.

title: 4 Top Stock Trades for Monday: GOOGL, FB, F, PINS
text: Facebook, Alphabet, Ford and Pinterest were our top stock trades from Friday. That said, let's have a closer look at the charts for Monday.

title: S&P 500 Index Rises Thanks to Big Tech
text: Apple, Amazon, and Facebook far exceeded expectations when they reported on Thursday.

title: Facebook raises settlement to $650 million in facial recognition lawsuit
text: Facebook Inc raised its settlement offer by $100 million to $650 million related to a lawsuit that claimed it illegally collected and stored biometric data for millions of users without their consent, the company said on Friday.

title: TikTok Accuses Facebook Of 'Copycat Products,' Declares 'We Are Not The Enemy'
text: The company's new CEO, Kevin Mayer, addressed its Chinese ownership in an open letter and also took aim at Facebook's "maligning attacks."

title: Nasdaq Spurts Higher; Facebook Breaks Out
text: Facebook was one of the three FAANG stocks to report bullish earnings Friday.

title: Facebook to showcase music videos after inking deal with record labels
text: Facebook has inked deals with music giants that will let its billions of users watch hit music videos alongside viral cat clips and political rants, the company said Friday.

title: Scott Galloway discusses the Big Tech antitrust hearings and breaking up Big Tech
text: Scott Galloway, Professor of Marketing at NYU Stern School of Business joins the On the Move panel to discuss the recent tech hearings as well as earnings results from those tech industry giants.

title: Facebook Adds Music Videos In Deal With Major Labels, Swipe At YouTube
text: Facebook said Friday it will launching a new feature in partnership with top labels to bring official music videos to U.S. users, zeroing in on a space dominated by YouTube. Partners including Sony Music, Universal Music, Warner Music, Merlin, BMG, Kobalt and indie labels and publishers will contribute content to a new destination for Music

title: Australia now has a template for forcing Facebook and Google to pay for news
text: Australia is closing in on a legally binding framework to force adtech giants Facebook and Google pay media companies for monetizing their news content when it’s posted to their social media platforms or otherwise aggregated and monetized. Back in April the country’s government announced it would adopt a mandatory code requiring the tech giants to […]

title: The Street's Reaction To Facebook's Q2: Bulls Turn More Bullish
text: Social media giant Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) reported second-quarter results Thursday that were highlighted by 11% revenue growth and an expansion of its total monthly user base across all platforms from 2.99 billion last quarter to 3.14 billion.

title: Facebook will add music videos after deals with labels
text: Facebook announced deals with Sony Music Group, Universal Music Group, Warner Music Group, Merlin, BMG, Kobalt and other independent music groups to launch music videos on its platform

title: Facebook Q2 Earnings Beat Estimates: ETFs Set to Soar
text: Impressed with the quarterly results, many analysts raised the price target on Facebook, spreading strong optimism in the company's growth prospect.

title: Facebook is launching licensed music videos in threat to YouTube
text: Facebook is taking a swing at YouTube by bringing officially licensed music videos to its platform.

title: Facebook will launch officially licensed music videos in the US starting this weekend
text: Facebook today confirmed it will begin rolling out official music videos across its platform in the U.S., as TechCrunch first reported, as well as introduce a new Music destination within Facebook Watch.

title: Australia May Be First To Force Google & Facebook To Pay For News
text: The Australian Government Friday unveiled a draft of the new mandatory code of conduct that would force tech giants Google and Facebook pay for news on their platforms. The document developed by the Australian Competition & Consumer Commission will be open for public review through August 28 and go before Parliament for a vote shortly

text: Yahoo Finance’s Alexis Christoforous and Brian Sozzi break down the latest market action with AdvisorShares CEO Noah Hamman.

title: The Ratings Game: Facebook stock spikes to record as prominent advertisers’ boycott doesn’t scare anyone
text: In the middle of a global pandemic, some of the largest advertisers in the world said they would boycott Facebook Inc.

title: Stock Markets Remain Mixed; Pinterest, Facebook Signal Social Media Strength

title: Why Facebook's ad business is doing better than Google's during the pandemic so far
text: Analysts said factors like the amount of revenue coming from direct-response versus brand advertising, exposure to areas like travel and sheer size gave Facebook's ad business a leg up over Google's in the second quarter.

title: Facebook stock jumps 9% to record high after profit tops $5 billion
text: Facebook Inc. FB, +7.85% shares rocketed more than 7% to new highs Friday morning following an earnings report that showed the social-media company collected more than $5 billion in profit despite a worldwide pandemic and targeted ad boycott.

title: Facebook's ad model is more resilient than Google's, says RBC's Mark Mahaney
text: The four biggest tech companies all beat on their quarterly earnings announcement.

title: Facebook stock soars on resilient revenue growth amid coronavirus
text: Facebook’s stock price soared in premarket trading Friday as Wall Street cheered its resilient revenue growth despite the coronavirus pandemic and an advertising boycott. Facebook shares had climbed about 6.6 percent to $250.09 by 7:15 a.m.

title: 'They are basically utilities' — Greycroft's Alan Patricof on Big Tech regulation
text: Everybody's got to face up to the fact they are basically utilities, which means something has to be done to make sure that a public utility doesn't take advantage of the public," Alan Patricof, co-founder and managing director of venture capital firm Greycroft, told CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin on Friday.

title: Evercore's Rippey on Facebook Earnings, boycott impact
text: Kevin Rippey, co-head of internet research at Evercore ISI, talks Facebook's Q2 earnings double beat, the impact of advertisers boycotting the company and its hiring practices.

title: Australia to force Google and Facebook to pay news publishers
text: A draft mandatory code announced by the Australian government would force Google and Facebook to pay news outlets for using their content.

title: Australia wants to force Facebook and Google to pay media companies for news
text: Australia is moving to impose sweeping new rules that would require Facebook and Google to pay media organizations for the use of their news content.

title: Apple, Facebook, and Amazon All Just Obliterated Earnings Estimates
text: Analysts are drastically underestimating tech companies' second-quarter performance.

title: Facebook, Google Will Need To Pay Australian Media For News Content, Or Risk Facing Hefty Fines Under New Law
text: Tech giants like Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) and Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOGL) (NASDAQ: GOOG) subsidiary Google will have to pay for news content generated by Australian media, Bloomberg reported Friday.

title: Facebook Completes Deal With Three Major Music Labels To Stream Official Music Videos
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) has completed deals with three large music companies for the right to stream music videos on its social media platform, Bloomberg reported late Thursday.

title: A day after Congressional grilling, big tech stocks add $250 billion
text: What was poised to be a bruising week for Big Tech has instead turned into a major windfall. The biggest names in Silicon Valley reported shockingly strong profits late Thursday, one day after their bosses weathered an intense grilling on Capitol Hill from lawmakers who questioned whether their power and influence was out of control.

title: Australia Orders Facebook, Google to Pay Local Media for News
text: Jul.31 -- Rod Sims.
